text: But the gravest difficulty, and perhaps the most important, in poetry meant solely for recitation, is the difficulty of achieving verbal beauty, or rather of making verbal beauty tell.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

text: You fall into my arms. You are the good gift of destruction's path, When life sickens more than disease. And boldness is the root of beauty. Which draws us together.
author: Boris Pasternak

text: Beyond the beauty, the sex, the titillation, the surface, there is a human being. And that has to emerge.
author: Jeanne Moreau

text: Most women are dissatisfied with their appearance - it's the stuff that fuels the beauty and fashion industries.
author: Annie Lennox

text: When I look at the majority of my own songs they really came from my own sense of personal confusion or need to express some pain or beauty - they were coming from a universal and personal place.
author: Annie Lennox
